text: No. Completely forgot there was such a thing. Does it have a WP number?

The strict answer to this within core NRx was Hobbesian. All you can do is set up the incentive structure for optimum shadow wraith behavior, and if that's still not good enough, leave. Still seems very plausible to me, as an ultimate prognosis.
... We're in a directionally rightist populist moment right now, which NRx never anticipated. The consequences of this haven't been anything close to fully processed IMHO.
Yarvin and Rufo are now both framing each other in the most derogatory way possible, which is objectively ridiculous. ...

... The achievements of both, in their different fields of engagement, are so extraordinary that what they have done would have been entirely unimaginable only a few years ago (when monotonic progressive insanity for ever was the only visible horizon).
... What had seemed to be the admantine pre-Rufo-Yarvin Overton Window has been melted down into slag, and they're both pointing at each other insultingly like the spiderman meme.
Very plausible, but equally, Yarvin would not have had the relevance he has if not for Rufo.
Yes, there are reciprocal correctives here that would be well worth recognizing (and articulating as such).
Rufo is seeing exactly the same thing, but concretely (the Cathedral is nothing but an upstream meme generator, and that's not even to depart much from Moldbug's own terminology). ...

... Yarvin's problem is complete insensitivity to the positive (rightist) potentials of The Anglo-Protestant Whig Tradition, which provides us with all of our weapons, as well as all of our problems. Since Urbit is a classic example of liberal social technology, this is ironic.
They're both quite witty actually, and both onto something real, if it wasn't framed so cattily (on both sides).

Classic paleolibertarian position on the Yarvin-Rufo spat is balanced. Scraping away the entire American tradition down to pre-revolutionary bedrock will not in fact ever find bedrock, but scraping away the Civil Rights and New Deal settlements is not an absurd medium-term goal.
Yarvin wants to turn us back to the early 17th Century, which is reciprocally over-ambitious.
Crypto in general is its most striking contemporary 'manifestation'. (Scare quotes there, of course, because occultation is essential to it.)
... "White people have civil rights too" is very obviously a sign of getting lost. As a tactical move in might make some very limited sense. ...
... Only enduring advantage I see is pushing the Left into a conundrum. "Oh no, civil rights framing can mean the people we want to destroy get protected too!"
Yes, sensible moderate centrism must prevail. No progressive leviathan, no feathery hats.
The English Whigs understood and respected what the American founders were doing. Manifest destiny of the Anglosphere.

If read in the Whig fashion, as it should be, as formal equality, it is entirely unobjectionable, indispensable to capitalistic social order, and vindicated by any anonymous agent. Only substantial equality is communist.
That's half of it, yes.
Liberal social technology effectively prevents this, though. Crypto is the model.

Already in the early 17th Century based Puritans were seeing communism emerge to their left, shuddering in horror, and effectively fencing it out. The Cromwellian Commonwealth offered levellers and diggers no opportunity to institutionalize their ideas. ...
... By the end of the century, the Glorious Revolution had locked them out so thoroughly they disappeared for centuries.
FFS.
Marx saw the dynamic development of capitalism as the greatest thing in the world, and he was right (weird Hegelian ideas about what would come afterwards notwithstanding).
This is a little too "Civil Rights, but now also for white people" for my tastes.
... Axing government should overwhelmingly be the main current. Trump's greatest hits (e.g. USAID) have only confirmed this.

The Puritans had their own thing going on, uncompromised authority of Scripture, freedom of conscience (and expression), and splitting, i.e. liberalism. That looks 'left' or 'right' depending on where other people are coming from.
... The Invisible Hands are the cause.
Yes.
Replace 'conclude' in your first sentence with 'state' and much of the puzzlement dissipates.
Dialectics is always cringe.

"We have to go back."
"Back to what?"
"Back to X."
"But X just led to this."
"Okay, before X."
"But that just led to X."
"Don't over-complicate it."
But then you need to break anonymity. I'm actually extremely sympathetic to what you're suggesting here, but this is why it's complicated.

... 
"We have to go back to the 17th Century."
"But that just led to the 18th Century."
"Okay, but at least we'll have spent more time in the 17th Century."
That's the only reason there's ever anything but lies.
Surprise!
... "OMG was there ever anything to prepare me for this?"
